data.value: Functions that mutate the passed object can produce unexpected behavior or errors and are not supported. See
A passed user-defined-function will be passed a Series for evaluation.
Function to use for aggregating the data. If a function, must either work when passed a DataFrame or when passed to DataFrame.apply.
list of functions and/or function names, e.g.
dict of axis labels -> functions, function names or list of such.
If 0 or 'index': apply function to each column. If 1 or 'columns': apply function to each row.

children.type_: The aggregation operations are always performed over an axis, either the
index (default) or the column axis. This behavior is different from
`var`), where the default is to compute the aggregation of the flattened
`agg` is an alias for `aggregate`. Use the alias.

data.value: Aggregate using one or more operations over the specified axis.
Aggregate these functions over the rows.

data.out:
A    B
sum  12.0  NaN
min   1.0  2.0
max   NaN  8.0

data.value: Aggregate different functions over the columns and rename the index of the resulting DataFrame.

data.out:
A    B    C
x  7.0  NaN  NaN
y  NaN  2.0  NaN
z  NaN  NaN  6.0

data.value: Perform operation over exponential weighted window.
